message.content:
<<<api>>>: BufferedImage
<<<code>>>: BufferedImage cp = new BufferedImage(img.getWidth(), img.getHeight(), img.getType());
Graphics2D g = cp.createGraphics();
g.drawImage(img, 0, 0, null);
g.dispose();
<<<explanation>>>: To create an exact copy of an image in Java, you can create a new BufferedImage with the same width, height, and type as the original image. Then, create a Graphics2D object from the new image and use the drawImage method to draw the original image onto the new image. Finally, dispose of the Graphics2D object. This will create a deep copy of the image with the same quality and scale.
